hints.content:
###Definitions

**Vertical angles** are angles opposite each other where two lines cross. [[☃ explanation 1]]

**Complementary angles** are when two angles add up to $90 ^\circ$. A common case is when they form a right angle. [[☃ explanation 2]]

**Supplementary angles** are when two angles add up to $180 ^\circ$. A common case is when they lie on the same side of a straight line. [[☃ explanation 3]]

options.explanation:
For example, $\angle AXD$ and $\angle BXC$ are vertical angles in the following diagram:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f35ddac8b7e46eb96d45e1c50ceb8b3736338961)

For example, $\angle BXC$ and $\angle CXD$ are complementary angles in the following diagram:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/45e32e3a43940b373e085dd8742bcfeea908a371)

*Note that $\angle BXD$ must be a right angle because $\angle AXB$ is a right angle.*

For example, $\angle AXD$ and $\angle DXC$ are supplementary angles in the following diagram:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/6bc829246f353b8491bfd407a196a7634c3aebb0)

hints.content:
###What is the relationship?

$\blueD{\angle a}$ and $\greenD{\angle b}$ can also be called $\angle EAB$ and $\angle BAC$.

These angles are not opposite each other where two lines cross, do not add up to $90^\circ$, and do not add up to $180^\circ$. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c1eae3dd4d2ccab643f493520fd4bbf59e3b825a )

question.content:
**What is the relationship between  $\blueD{\angle a}$ and $\greenD{\angle b}$?**  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/c1eae3dd4d2ccab643f493520fd4bbf59e3b825a)
